page.title: 19ILKESTON ADVERTISER
page.content:
The{Ilkeston Adertiser}is 104 years old. The title page is set out the same as it was 100 years ago. There are{three reporters}and they are all nationally trained. A reporter makes about 50 reports a week. Other people also send in reports.
About{40,000 people}read the Advertiser a week. The major stories of 1985 were the{murder}that happened in{Stanley Common}where a body was found in a freezer and also about the {Britannia Park,}a new theme park near Ilkeston. The newspaper believes in reporting the news and in trying to arouse public interest in local affairs. One such campaign was against the new relief road.
